metadata.title: CVE-2018-14779 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description: A buffer overflow issue was discovered in the Yubico-Piv 1.5.0 smartcarddriver. The file lib/ykpiv.c contains the following code in the function`ykpiv_transfer_data()`: {% highlight c %} if(*out_len + recv_len - 2 >max_out) { fprintf(stderr, "Output buffer to small, wanted to write %lu,max was %lu.", *out_len + recv_len - 2, max_out); } if(out_data) {memcpy(out_data, data, recv_len - 2); out_data += recv_len - 2; *out_len +=recv_len - 2; } {% endhighlight %} -- it is clearly checked whether thebuffer is big enough to hold the data copied using `memcpy()`, but no errorhandling happens to avoid the `memcpy()` in such cases. This code path canbe triggered with malicious data coming from a smartcard.

criterions.comment: yubico-piv-tool: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
